stepAnswer: By selling 10 items, the revenue increases by 50 revenue per item, while when you sell 15 items, the revenue increases by 70 revenue per item.
stepTitle: The revenue generated by selling $$x$$ items is given by $$R(x)=2x^2+10x$$. Find R'(15) and interpret. Compare R'(15) to R'(10), and explain the difference.
answerLatex: By selling $$10$$ items, the revenue increases by $$50$$ revenue per item, while when you sell $$15$$ items, the revenue increases by $$70$$ revenue per item.
